mute.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: someone who is mute does not speak, or refuses to speak
mute.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Billy continued to stand there, mute and defiant.
mute.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: someone who is mute is unable to speak
mute.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make the sound of something quieter, or make it disappear completely
mute.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Excess noise can be reduced by muting alarms and telephones.
mute.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make a musical instrument sound softer
mute.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to reduce the level of criticism, protest, discussion etc that is happening
mute.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The incident so shocked all the students that it muted further protest.
mute.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer
